001package io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import io.github.ai4ci.abm.PersonDemographic;
006import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.ImmutableInHostStochasticState;
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.inhost.InHostStochasticState;
008import io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration;
009import io.github.ai4ci.config.inhost.StochasticModel;
010import io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils;
011import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
012
013/**
014 * Default initialiser for the stochastic in‑host model.
015 *
016 * <p>
017 * This interface constructs an {@link InHostStochasticState} from a
018 * {@link StochasticModel} configuration and execution parameters. The
019 * implementation samples initial counts and rates (targets, immune pools,
020 * priming and waning rates) and populates the initial state containers.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * Role in composition: the initialiser is consumed by
024 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultPersonInitialiser} and is
025 * composed into {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.builders.DefaultModelBuilder}. The
026 * model builder delegates to this interface's default implementation using
027 * {@code DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser.super.initialiseInHostModel(...)}.
028 * Keeping this logic isolated makes it trivial to swap alternative stochastic
029 * initialisers.
030 *
031 * <p>
032 * Demographic adjustment: if a {@link PersonDemographic} is provided the
033 * configuration is adjusted using
034 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.util.ReflectionUtils#modify} before sampling so
035 * demographic specific scalings from
036 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.DemographicAdjustment.Phenomenological}
037 * can be applied.
038 *
039 * <p>
040 * Extension guidance: implementers should focus this component on creating the
041 * immutable in‑host stochastic state and not on external IO; expensive
042 * per‑person computation should be performed during outbreak baselining if
043 * possible.
044 *
045 * @author Rob Challen
046 */
047public interface DefaultInHostStochasticStateInitialiser {
048
049        /**
050         * Create an {@link InHostStochasticState} from a stochastic configuration.
051         *
052         * <p>
053         * The default implementation applies demographic adjustment (if a
054         * demographic is present), copies scalar rates and samples distributional
055         * entries to populate initial target and immune pools used by the stochastic
056         * update mechanics.
057         *
058         * @param configuration the stochastic in‑host configuration
059         * @param execConfig    execution configuration providing contextual rates
060         * @param person        optional demographic used to apply demographic
061         *                      adjustments
062         * @param rng           sampler used for stochastic draws
063         * @param time          current simulation time used to timestamp the state
064         * @return an initial {@link InHostStochasticState}
065         */
066        default InHostStochasticState initialiseInHostModel(
067                        StochasticModel configuration, ExecutionConfiguration execConfig,
068                        Optional<PersonDemographic> person, Sampler rng, int time
069        ) {
070
071                if (person.isPresent()) {
072                        configuration = ReflectionUtils.modify(
073                                        configuration, execConfig.getDemographicAdjustment(),
074                                        person.get()
075                        );
076                }
077
078                return ImmutableInHostStochasticState.builder().setTime(time)
079                                .setBaselineViralInfectionRate(
080                                                configuration.getBaselineViralInfectionRate()
081                                )
082                                .setBaselineViralReplicationRate(
083                                                configuration.getBaselineViralReplicationRate()
084                                ).setVirionsDiseaseCutoff(configuration.getVirionsDiseaseCutoff())
085                                // .setConfig(configuration)
086                                .setTargets(configuration.getTargetCellCount())
087                                .setTargetSusceptible(configuration.getTargetCellCount())
088                                .setTargetExposed(0).setTargetInfected(0).setVirions(0)
089                                .setVirionsProduced(0).setImmunePriming(0).setImmuneActive(0)
090                                .setImmuneTargetRatio(
091                                                configuration.getImmuneTargetRatio().sample(rng)
092                                )
093                                .setImmuneActivationRate(
094                                                configuration.getImmuneActivationRate().sample(rng)
095                                )
096                                .setImmuneWaningRate(
097                                                configuration.getImmuneWaningRate().sample(rng)
098                                )
099                                .setTargetRecoveryRate(
100                                                configuration.getTargetRecoveryRate().sample(rng)
101                                )
102                                .setInfectionCarrierProbability(
103                                                configuration.getInfectionCarrierProbability().sample(rng)
104                                ).build();
105        }
106}
